medical_history.chief_complaint: 3 days of RUQ and RLQ abdominal pain, loss of appetite, and lethargy.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 3 days ago. The abdominal pain is constant, dull in nature, and worsens with movement. The patient has lost appetite and experienced excessive sleepiness since the onset of symptoms. The patient has not had a bowel movement in the last 72 hours but has been able to pass gas consistently. No previous episodes like this, though there was mild gastric discomfort with fatty meals in the past.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Atrial fibrillation on Coumadin, abnormal liver function tests, attention deficit disorder, wrist pain, mesenteric panniculitis with "misty mesentery" and small lymphadenopathy on CT (stable), colonic polyps.
medical_history.family_history: Father: Personal medical history includes pacemaker (PPM), diabetes mellitus (DM), thyroid disease, stroke, and another unspecified condition. Mother: Minor cancer and diverticulosis. Son: Kidney stones, otherwise healthy.
